TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit XpsSerializationProgressChangedEventArgs extends System.ComponentModel.ProgressChangedEventArgs

MemberSignature.Value: public XpsSerializationProgressChangedEventArgs (System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.XpsWritingProgressChangeLevel writingLevel, int pageNumber, int progressPercentage, object userToken);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.XpsWritingProgressChangeLevel writingLevel, int32 pageNumber, int32 progressPercentage, object userToken) cil managed

Docs.param: A value that specifies whether the change in progress is an additional page completed or an additional document completed.
A value that specifies the total number of pages or the number of documents that are serialized at the time of the event.
A value that specifies the percentage of the total serialization job that is complete.
A user-supplied object that provides additional information for the event handler.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.XpsSerializationProgressChangedEventArgs"> class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When is <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.XpsWritingProgressChangeLevel>, is the number of pages. When is <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.XpsWritingProgressChangeLevel>, is the number of fixed documents.

Docs.summary: Gets the number of pages or documents that have been serialized.
Docs.value: The total pages or documents have been serialized at the point when the event occurred.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.XpsSerializationProgressChangedEventArgs.WritingLevel%2A> is <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.XpsWritingProgressChangeLevel>, then PageNumber is the number of pages. When <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.XpsSerializationProgressChangedEventArgs.WritingLevel%2A> is <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Serialization.XpsWritingProgressChangeLevel>, then PageNumber is the number of fixed documents.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates the scope of the progress indicator.
Docs.value: The scope of the progress indicator.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The WritingLevel property identifies whether the event refers to the progress in serializing a sequence of documents or the pages in a single document.
